bio: Julia Child was a beloved American chef and television personality who brought French cuisine to the masses. She is best known for her cookbook 'Mastering the Art of French Cooking,' which she co-authored with two French chefs. Child's warm personality and sense of humor made her a household name, and her legacy continues to inspire chefs around the world.

recipe.cookingMethod: Melt the butter and sugar in a skillet, then arrange the apples in a layer on top. Cover with puff pastry and bake until golden. Invert onto a plate to serve.

bio: Alain Ducasse is a world-renowned French chef and restaurateur who has earned an astounding 21 Michelin stars throughout his career. He is known for his innovative approach to French cuisine, and his restaurants around the world are consistently ranked among the best in the world.
